bug.author: antonwnk
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h3>What is the problem?</denchmark-h>
Scikit-learn sometimes takes None as a parameter. This does not seem to agree with TensorBoard's HParams, as an error pops up when None is sampled from my parameter space. Not sure how this should be handled â€“ detect and replace it with str(None)? ðŸ˜€ (running on ray 0.8.0, performing hyperparameter search with HyperOpt) <denchmark-h:h3>Reproduction (REQUIRED)</denchmark-h>
No script as it's kind of straightforward: define a hyperparameter space with the value None in it.

comments.comment: Hm, can you try running the latest version of Ray? This should be fixed.
